description._content: O'Sullivan, Timothy H.,, 1840-1882,, photographer. Destruction of a railroad bridge Hartford, Conn. : War Photograph & Exhibition Company, [photographed May 26, 1864, printed later] 1 photographic print on stereo card : albumen ; 4 x 7 in. Notes: Photo shows a smoldering railroad bridge on the North Ana River in Virginia. Confederate troops destroyed the bridge to slow down advancing Union soldiers. (Source: Zeller, p. 73) Title from item. Series: The War for the Union. Photographic War History (no. 762). Civil War Photograph Collection. Forms part of: Civil War Photograph Collection (Library of Congress). Published in: The Civil War in depth / Bob Zeller. San Francisco: Chronicle Books, 1997-2000, v. 1, p. 73. Subjects: Railroad bridges--Virginia--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Destruction & pillage. Format: Stereographs--1880-1910. Albumen prints--1880-1910. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s02801 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.2s02801 Call Number: LOT 4177, no. 201 [item]
